problem.script:
from __future__ import division import math
bigm = random.randrange(180, 220, 5) bigr = random.randrange(90, 120, 5) littler = (bigr - random.randrange(5, 15, 1)) littlem = random.randrange(8, 12, 1) v = random.randrange(18, 22, 1)
I = 0.5 * bigm * bigr * bigr
omega = littler * littlem * v / I
lostE = 0.5 * littlem * v ** 2 - 0.5 * I * omega **2
problem.p: A merry-go-round (pictured) is sitting in a playground. It is free to rotate, but is currently stationary. You can model it as a cylinder of mass $bigm kg and radius $bigr cm. The poles near the edge are $littler cm from the center.
Someone hits one of the poles with a $littlem kg sledgehammer moving at $v m/s in a direction tangent to the edge of the merry-go-round. The hammer is not moving after it hits the merry-go-round.
How much energy is lost in this collision?
